Community

White Heaven Community Football Club is more than just building a club, we are building a community.

WHCFC. is more than a football club; it wishes to build and develop and sustain community spirit and synergy by providing free opportunities to its members to not just play football but also participate in tournament festivals as well as free educational workshops organized by WHCFC. During tournament festivals, for instance, WHCFC. will enable community members to cheer on football teams, enjoy picnics in the park and have fun while getting to know other community members and families, developing relationships with them as well as with local businesses and local politicians. WHCFC. will also plan, design and deliver educational sessions/workshops to communities, at no cost, to help them develop critical skills required to succeed in their personal and professional lives, e.g., project management as life skills, mental unity in community, basic computer programming, etc. Community members attending these free sessions will in turn enable their communities to develop as well.

WHCFC believes in the transformative power of sports, and our vision and focus are to increase football participation while eliminating barriers to this, to give Canadians access to and stay involved in football in communities; this aligns to the Canadian Government initiatives to pursue healthy lifestyles, because it believes that sport plays an important role helping Canadians build the skills they need to grow and thrive physically, mentally and socially. Community members that align to these values will help WHCFC meet its goals and promote FIFA World Cup coming to Toronto in 2026, thereby spreading the passion and fever of football through surrounding communities.

WHCFC wishes to establish a more accessible and locally organized football program aimed at reducing barriers to participation, particularly among Black and racialized communities, as well as people with low incomes and newcomers. Communities, local businesses and political offices are asked to support this initiative by participating in football opportunities, tournament festivals and educational sessions. They can also show support by helping WHCFC. meet its vision and goals via word of mouth promotion of this program and thereby help reduce above-mentioned barriers.

WHCFC will seek funding to enable the above-mentioned drop-in experiences, multi-week programs, and the acquisition of equipment to improve access to football and physical activity; the club will seek funding also for the development of educational resources to increase participation and retention rates, because it wants to make sport inclusive, welcoming and equitable for everyone. By having sufficient funds to do the above, the community will benefit.
